ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed a better sense of how to convey certain feeling or emotion using text, shape, and image (and the style and timing of each). I also learned how to use more of AfterEffects.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I honestly have very little criticism of this course. Chris has been a professor at Yale for over 50 years, and it really shows. The assignments are structured (this is more of a design course rather than an art course), but I liked being able to solve a specific problem. The assignments were interesting and it is helpful to see your classmates' projects too. Maybe a little more specific criticism from Chris himself would be helpful, but then again I appreciate how he allows each student to develop his or her own style, but overall extremely approachable and helpful professor

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Take it if you want to improve your design and eye for motion. This is a lot of work!! But I can definitely say it's probably my top 3 favorite classes at Yale.
